summary: The World Trade Center Health Program provides health services to eligible responders and survivors for conditions related to the Sept. 11 attacks. Timely access is an important part of quality health care, but people have reported delays accessing program services outside the New York City area. We reviewed whether the program assesses the timeliness of access to these services. The program's quality assurance committee is...
title: World Trade Center Health Program: Quality Assurance Program Should Include Monitoring of Access to Health Services
